item.text: Bezalel made the altar for the burnt offering of acacia wood 7½ feet long and 7½ feet wide—it was square—and its height was 4½ feet.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> its <st data-num="07161" class="">horns</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> its <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="06438" class="">corners</st>; its <st data-num="07161" class="">horns</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">part of</st> it,<n id="1" /> and he <st data-num="06823" class="">overlaid</st> it with <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="03627" class="">utensils</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>—the <st data-num="05518" class="">pots</st>, the <st data-num="03257" class="">shovels</st>, the <st data-num="04219" class="">tossing bowls</st>, the <st data-num="04207" class="">meat hooks</st>, and the <st data-num="04289" class="">fire pans</st>—he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> its <st data-num="03627" class="">utensils</st> of <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="04345" class="">grating</st> for the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, a <st data-num="04639 07568" class="">network</st> of <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> its <st data-num="03749" class="">ledge</st>, <st data-num="02677" class="">halfway</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">up</st> from the <st data-num="04295" class="">bottom</st>.

He <st data-num="03332" class="">cast</st> <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="02885" class="">rings</st> for the <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="07099" class="">corners</st> of the <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="04345" class="">grating</st>, to provide <st data-num="01004" class="">places</st> for the <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st>.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st> of <st data-num="07848" class="">acacia</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> and <st data-num="06823" class="">overlaid</st> them with <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>.
He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to carry it. He made the altar hollow, out of boards.
He made the large basin of bronze and its pedestal of bronze from the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
Bezalel made the courtyard. For the south side the hangings of the courtyard were of fine twisted linen, 150 feet long,

with<n id="1" /> their <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st>, with the <st data-num="02053" class="">hooks</st> of the <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="02838" class="">bands</st> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>.

For the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">side</st> the hangings were<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03967 0520" class="">150 feet</st>, with their <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st>, with the <st data-num="02053" class="">hooks</st> of the <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="02838" class="">bands</st> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>.

For the <st data-num="03220" class="">west</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">side</st> there were<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07050" class="">hangings</st> <st data-num="02572 0520" class="">75 feet</st> long, with<n id="2" /> their <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st>, with the <st data-num="02053" class="">hooks</st> of the <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="02838" class="">bands</st> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>.

For the <st data-num="06924" class="">east</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">side</st>, toward the <st data-num="04217" class="">sunrise</st>, it was <st data-num="02572 0520" class="">75 feet</st> wide,<n id="1" />

with <st data-num="07050" class="">hangings</st> <st data-num="0413">on</st> one <st data-num="03802" class="">side</st><n id="1" /> of the gate that were <st data-num="02568 06240 0520" class="">22½ feet</st> long, with their <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st>,

and for the <st data-num="08145" class="">second</st> <st data-num="03802" class="">side</st> of the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> of the <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st>, just <st data-num="02088" class="">like</st> the <st data-num="02088" class="">other</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="07050" class="">hangings</st> were <st data-num="02568 06240 0520" class="">22½ feet</st> long, with their <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st>.

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="07050" class="">hangings</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st> the <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st> were of <st data-num="08336">fine</st> <st data-num="07806" class="">twisted</st> <st data-num="08336" class="">linen</st>.

The <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st> for the <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> were <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>. The <st data-num="02053" class="">hooks</st> of the <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="02836" class="">bands</st> were <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, their <st data-num="07218" class="">tops</st> were <st data-num="06826" class="">overlaid</st> with <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> of the <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st> had <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> <st data-num="02836" class="">bands</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="04539" class="">curtain</st><n id="1" /> for the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> of the <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st> was of <st data-num="08504" class="">blue</st>, <st data-num="0713" class="">purple</st>, and <st data-num="08438 08144" class="">scarlet yarn</st> and <st data-num="08336" class="">fine</st> <st data-num="07806" class="">twisted</st> <st data-num="08336" class="">linen</st>, the <st data-num="04639" class="">work</st> of an <st data-num="07551" class="">embroiderer</st>. It was <st data-num="06242 0520" class="">30 feet</st> <st data-num="0753" class="">long</st> and, <st data-num="05980" class="">like</st> the <st data-num="07050" class="">hangings</st> in the <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st>, it was <st data-num="02568 0520" class="">7½ feet</st> <st data-num="06967 07341" class="">high</st>,

with <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">posts</st> and their <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st>. Their <st data-num="02053" class="">hooks</st> and their <st data-num="02838" class="">bands</st> were <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, and their <st data-num="07218" class="">tops</st> were <st data-num="06826" class="">overlaid</st> with <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>.
All the tent pegs of the tabernacle and of the courtyard all around were bronze.

This is the inventory of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony, which was counted by the order of Moses, being the work of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar, son of Aaron the priest.
Now Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything that the Lord had commanded Moses;
and with him was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an artisan, a designer, and an embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen.
All the gold that was used for the work, in all the work of the sanctuary (namely, the gold of the wave offering) was 29 talents and 730 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
The silver of those who were numbered of the community was 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel,

<st data-num="01235">one beka</st> per <st data-num="01538" class="">person</st>, that is, a <st data-num="04276" class="">half</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekel</st>,<n id="1" /> according to the <st data-num="06944" class="">sanctuary</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekel</st>, for <st data-num="03605" class="">everyone</st> who <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed over</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> those <st data-num="06485" class="">numbered</st>, from <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> or <st data-num="04605" class="">older</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="08337 03967 0505 07969 0505 02568 03967 02572">603,550</st> in all.<n id="3" />

The <st data-num="03967" class="">100</st> <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> <st data-num="01961">were</st> used for <st data-num="03332" class="">casting</st> the <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st> of the <st data-num="06944" class="">sanctuary</st> and the <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st> of the special <st data-num="06532" class="">curtain</st>—<st data-num="03967" class="">100</st> <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st> for <st data-num="03967" class="">100</st> <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st>, <st data-num="03603" class="">one talent</st> per <st data-num="0134" class="">base</st>.
From the remaining 1,775 shekels he made hooks for the posts, overlaid their tops, and made bands for them.
The bronze of the wave offering was seventy talents and 2,400 shekels.

With it he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="0134" class="">bases</st> for the <st data-num="06607" class="">door</st> of the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> of <st data-num="04150" class="">meeting</st>, the <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, the <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="04345" class="">grating</st> for it, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="03627" class="">utensils</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>,
the bases for the courtyard all around, the bases for the gate of the courtyard, all the tent pegs of the tabernacle, and all the tent pegs of the courtyard all around.
